sentences.en: A half-hour daily walk can be more beneficial than one hard bout of exercise a week.
sentences.cn: 每天散步半小时会比一周剧烈运动一次对身体更有益。

sentences.en: A young baby may frequently get a bout of hiccups during or soon after a feed.
sentences.cn: 小婴儿进食过程中或刚刚进食后经常会打嗝。

sentences.en: Feeling of sadness follows a bout of pleasure.
He felt irritated and strangely fragile, as if he were recovering from a severe bout of flu.
sentences.cn: 他感到恼火和莫名其妙的虚弱，仿佛经历了一场重感冒，正在康复。

sentences.en: He was recovering from a severe bout of flu.
sentences.cn: 他患了严重的流感，尚未痊愈。

sentences.en: He will now fight Kevin Ford on the five-bout card.
sentences.cn: 他将在五局制比赛中迎战凯文·福特。

sentences.en: He's a former champion and is expected to win the bout.
sentences.cn: 他是上届冠军,预期会赢得比赛.

sentences.en: I just felt the need to write bout it, I guess.
sentences.cn: 我想我就是觉得有必要对此写点儿什么。

sentences.en: I was suffering with a bout of nerves.
I've just recovered from a bout of malaria.
Niki's voice provoked a new bout of unreasoning anger.
sentences.cn: 妮基一开口又激起了无名的怒火。

sentences.en: This severe bout of illness has done serious damage to his health.
sentences.cn: 这场大病损伤了他的体力.

sentences.en: This will be his eighth title bout in 19 months.
sentences.cn: 这将是他19个月里的第8次卫冕赛。

trans.tran_cn: （疾病或情绪的）发作，一小段时间，拳击比赛
trans.tran_en: a short period of time during which you do something a lot, especially something that is bad for you
